result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle A Dantonio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable. For add. on 1655 Humboldt and add. on 845 Van Buren
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($150.00) gj

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Defendant sentenced to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 6 months. If revoked huber allowed for work.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
    *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment.
    *   No new criminal law violations arising to probable cause.
    *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
    *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by March 22, 2017
          or an entry of a civil judgment.
    *   No violent contact with anyone.
    *   DNA to be taken and surcharge to be paid by March 22, 2017.

20 day appeal rights given.
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights; received and filed.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Ann Heaps for attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court late this morning and ordered to return at 1:30 p.m. Court orders previously issued warrant withdrawn. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 150.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Bridget Krause for Attorney Robert J Hampton in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

-Attorney Robert Hampton III in court requesting to reschedule February 29, 2016 at 8:30 a.m. scheduling conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 31 on March 2, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 2/29/16 at 8:30 am, Branch 31.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Matter before the Court for Jury Trial.  Defendant not present.  On state's motion, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued with remand to commissioner.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Final pretrial held off record.  Case remains set for jury trial on February 15, 2016 at 9:00 a.m., Branch 31.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
-From Attorney Robert Hampton II on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
From Attorney Robert Hampton II on behalf of his client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for projected guilty plea and sentencing. Defense counsel requests jury trial date. 

Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 31. All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserved, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.
 Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant wishes to resolve the case tomorrow.  State unable to comply with victim notification in that short of a notice.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court with attorney Robert J. Hampton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests time to review.  Cae adjourned for another pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.   
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michelle A Dantonio in court.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
